findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to massively stop addresses from transactions. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `multipleBotlistAddress` function.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: Repeating the same code in multiple places can make the contract harder to read and maintain.

findings.title: MVN - Μisleading Variables Naming
findings.description: The contract contains variable names that are not specific and descriptive, affecting code readability.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from the taxes to swap them for ETH. The variable `swapTokensAtAmount` sets a threshold where the contract will trigger the swap functionality. If the variable is set to a big number, then the contract will swap a huge amount of tokens for ETH. It is important to note that the price of the token representing it, can be highly volatile.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases unnecessarily the gas consumption since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality that replaces it.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming convention guidelines, which can decrease readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Missing events arithmetic in BABYTOKEN.sol contract.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L12 - Using Variables before Declaration
findings.description: The contract is using a variable before the declaration. This is usually happening either if it has not been declared yet or if the variable has been declared in a different scope.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block. When this happens, the local variable "shadows" the outer variable, meaning that it takes precedence over the outer variable within the scope in which it is declared.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: Validate variable setters to prevent potential security issues.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: It is recommended to use assembly sparingly and only when necessary, as it can be difficult to read and understand compared to Solidity code.
